title: Skills discovery and install gating

detailed_design.description: Extend the skills registry with optional discovery (e.g. a minimal 'skill hub' or curated list) and install/enable gating so users can safely add skills. Keeps skills local-first and avoids unnecessary vendor lock-in.
affected_files: data/ or config for skill definitions
detailed_design.solution: 1. Define a minimal discovery source: e.g. curated list in config or a static JSON, or optional ClawHub-style registry (self-hosted or read-only). 2. API: GET /api/skills/available or similar returning discoverable skills with metadata; POST /api/skills/install or PATCH to add/enable a skill (with validation and gating). 3. Install gating: validate skill manifest, check dependencies, require explicit user confirmation in UI. 4. Persist enabled skills in existing skills config; document how to add local skills.

acceptance_criteria: Users can discover available skills (curated list or optional registry)
Install or enable a skill is gated (validation, optional confirmation)
Enabled skills are persisted and reflected in /api/skills
Local-first: local skill definitions supported; no mandatory external registry

user_stories.story: As a user, I want to browse and add new skills safely so I can extend my agent.
As a developer, I want to add a local skill without depending on a central registry.

technical_notes.current_issue: Skills registry exists (PBI-026) but no discovery or install flow
